## Data

Data were collected and made available by Dr. Kristen Gorman and the Palmer Station, Antarctica LTER, a member of the Long Term Ecological Research Network.

The palmerpenguins package contains two datasets. One is called `penguins`, and is a simplified version of the raw data. The second dataset is `penguins_raw`, and contains all the variables and original names as downloaded. 

Both datasets contain data for 344 penguins. There are 3 different species of penguins in this dataset (`Adelie`, `Chinstrap` and `Gentoo`), collected from 3 islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica.

![Meet the palmer penguins](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/reference/figures/lter_penguins.png)

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(palmerpenguins) #install.packages("palmerpenguins")
library(tidyverse)

```
## Single trait distribution

Distribution of flipper lengths in the three penguin species. 
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_density(aes(fill = species, x = flipper_length_mm), alpha = 0.7) +
  xlab (" Flipper length (mm)") +
  ylab ("Density")
```
Distribution of bill lengths in the three penguin species
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_histogram(aes(x = bill_length_mm)) +
  facet_wrap(~ species) +
  xlab ("Bill length (mm)") +
  ylab ("Count (n)")

```
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_density(aes(x = bill_length_mm, fill = island), alpha = 0.5) +
  facet_wrap(~species, nrow = 3)

```

Distribution of bill depth in the three species

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_density(aes(fill = species, x = bill_depth_mm), alpha = 0.7) +
  xlab (" Bill depth (mm)") +
  ylab ("Density") 
```

## Relationship between multiple traits

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
ggplot(penguins, mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g)) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(color = species), shape = 1) + 
  geom_smooth() +
  xlab (" Flipper length (mm)") +
  ylab ("Body mass (g)")
```

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo

penguins
penguins2<- penguins$species
penguins3 <- substr(penguins2, 1, 1)
penguins <- cbind(penguins, penguins3)

ggplot(penguins, mapping = aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) +
  geom_smooth() +
  xlab (" Flipper length (mm)") +
  ylab ("Bill length (mm") +
  geom_text(mapping = aes(label = penguins3))

```

## Sexual dimorphism

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
## demo
## demo
ggplot(penguins) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = sex, y = flipper_length_mm)) +
  facet_wrap(~ species, nrow=1) +
  ylab ("Flipper length (mm)")
```
